title: Mexican Grand Prix: How Lewis Hamilton's 'impossible' stint and Ferrari errors gave Mercedes an unlikely win
text:
Even with as many grand prix wins as Lewis Hamilton has, it's still fairly common to hear him proclaim after the race how difficult it was for him.

Given how often he and Mercedes have won in the last six or so seasons - 62 times and counting for the driver, and 91 for the team - it can feel a little grating.

Likewise, whenever Hamilton or Mercedes team principal Toto Wolff states that Mercedes will struggle at a given track, it needs to be taken with a pinch of salt.

But Mercedes’ Mexican Grand Prix was another performance that underlined their undeniable brilliance as a team, as Ferrari squandered another front-row lockout.
